Note to self: Auto flyspell-mode in the Emacs starter kit really slows down typing. The EmacsWiki suggests that this can be improved when using aspell by invoking (setq ispell-extra-args '("--sug-mode=ultra")). But this is already in place in the starter-kit and doesn’t help much. Turning it off appears to be the right answer, but it disables auto-highlighting of misspelled words. This problem appears on OSX–it’s not noticeable on Emacs 24 running on Ubuntu.
